Activity: Arrive at the office, check emails, and review the notes from yesterday's meetings. Drink a cup of warm water with honey and lemon.

Finalize the meeting agenda for a follow-up meeting with @rn-1, @rn-2, @rn-3 and @pchmp-1 to review the draft influenza questionnaire. Emphasize the need for their feedback on clarity, relevance, and potential patient concerns.

Follow-up meeting with @rn-1, @rn-2, @rn-3 and @pchmp-1 to discuss the draft questionnaire. Address their concerns, refine the language, and ensure it captures the necessary information effectively and compassionately.
Revise the questionnaire based on the feedback from the clinical staff. Focus on improving clarity and addressing any potential biases or sensitivities in the questions.
Meet with @ehrv-1 to discuss potential EHR customization options and any limitations related to implementing the questionnaire and storing the data. Understand vendor support capabilities.
Lunch Break - Head to the cafeteria and have a light lunch.

Create a detailed workflow diagram illustrating how the new influenza data collection steps will be integrated into the existing patient registration/intake process. Highlight potential bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Email @itpm-1 to schedule a meeting to discuss project timelines, resource allocation, and potential risks associated with implementing the EHR changes. Make sure everyone's on the same page.
Refine the technical specifications document for the EHR integration developers based on the meeting with the EHR vendor and the developed workflow diagram.
Contact @qatest-1, @qatest-2 to discuss testing requirements for the new questionnaire and data collection process. Gather their input on testing scenarios and expected outcomes.
Review the day's accomplishments, update the project plan, and address any outstanding emails.
Catch up on industry news and best practices related to EHR implementation and data collection. A little professional reading never hurts!
